content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Copper Cable Factory at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Cable factory input chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
– Burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) [direction: RIGHT]
– Additional burner inserter at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5)
– Burner inserter with fuel (coal) at Position(x=1.5, y=17.5)
– Assembling machine at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5)

This structure is set up to receive raw materials from the extraction system and process them into copper cable.

### Belt Depot System at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Wooden chest placed at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5) serving as an isolated belt depot
– Transport belt segment adjacent at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5)
– Depot burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) [direction: UP], whose pickup position is used as the final target for belt connections

This setup is intended to serve as an intermediary point for transferring items via the multi‐segment belt.

### Extraction System at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5)
Consists of the following entity:
– Extraction system burner inserter at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5) with drop position at Position(x=-3.5, y=28.5)

This node is used as the source point for extraction operations connecting towards the production networks.

### Electricity Generator at Position(x=-0.5, y=24.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Steam engine at Position(x=-0.5, y=24.5)
– Boiler at Position(x=-5.5, y=24.0)
– Offshore pump at Position(x=-7.5, y=25.5)

This group forms the power production system, although connection attempts to it via transport belts have led to repeated errors.

ERROR TIPS

– Belt Connection Errors:
  • Transport belts must be connected to an inserter rather than directly to a steam engine. Always verify that the target entity accepts item input before establishing a belt connection.
  
– Placement Distance Errors:
  • When placing an entity (for example, a wooden chest), ensure the player is within the maximum placement range. Move closer if the target position is too far.
  
– Inventory Availability Errors:
  • Before attempting to place an object, confirm that the item is present in the inventory to avoid “no … in inventory” errors.
  
– Variable Reference Errors:
  • Use the correct variable names when referencing entities (for example, ensure that depot_chest is used instead of undefined names like target_chest) to prevent NameError exceptions.
